This may seem a bit off-topic but I would like to present this 
tidbit to o=
ur community.

It is believed that the Shinsengumi uniform of which we are =
all 
familiar was inspired by those worn by the 47-ronin.  Basically the 
j=
agged-edge design.  Although the Shinsengumi color scheme (and our 
guys di=
d change their uniform later) may be different the intent to 
evoke the 47 =
ronin was the goal.

Over time the black-white "look" was incorporated into=
 Shinsengumi 
media perhaps to add more variety.

You see the uniform/desig=
n in many places.  Even in movements which 
also claim to stand for "loyalt=
y" for whatever reason:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DyRxK0wsgL4Q
(2 mi=
n 30 sec vid)

please click on the outstanding write up provided by "ONIAZU=
MA"

It is also interesting to note that many Bakumatsu groups like the 
Sh=
insengumi, Byakkotai (Aizu) and even the Sekihoutai! have all at 
one point=
 or another been hijacked for right-wing, militarists 
purposes because his=
tory belongs to "everybody" and they become fair 
game for people with an a=
genda.

These crazy fringe groups ofcourse do not represent all Japanese 
p=
eople.  They are just being outspoken due to the increasingly 
conservative=
 political climate in Japan.

ance:
